nodes.name: EGFR
nodes.description: Epidermal growth factor receptor - a protein that helps cells grow and divide

nodes.name: TP53
nodes.description: Tumor protein p53 - a tumor suppressor gene that regulates cell division

nodes.name: KRAS
nodes.description: KRAS proto-oncogene - involved in cell signaling pathways that control cell growth

nodes.name: BRCA1
nodes.description: Breast cancer type 1 susceptibility protein - involved in DNA repair

nodes.name: Colon Cancer
nodes.description: Colorectal cancer is cancer that starts in the colon or rectum

nodes.name: Lung Cancer
nodes.description: Cancer that begins in the lungs, often associated with smoking

nodes.name: Breast Cancer
nodes.description: Cancer that forms in the cells of the breasts

nodes.name: Erlotinib
nodes.description: An EGFR tyrosine kinase inhibitor used to treat non-small cell lung cancer

nodes.name: Cetuximab
nodes.description: A monoclonal antibody that blocks EGFR, used to treat colorectal cancer

nodes.name: Olaparib
nodes.description: A PARP inhibitor used to treat BRCA-mutated cancers

edges.description: EGFR is overexpressed in colon cancer and associated with poor prognosis

properties.evidence: Multiple studies show elevated EGFR expression in colorectal tumors

edges.description: EGFR mutations are common in non-small cell lung cancer

properties.evidence: EGFR mutations found in 10-15% of NSCLC cases in Western populations

edges.description: KRAS mutations are found in approximately 40% of colorectal cancers

properties.evidence: KRAS mutations predict resistance to EGFR-targeted therapy

edges.description: BRCA1 mutations significantly increase breast cancer risk

properties.evidence: BRCA1 mutation carriers have up to 80% lifetime risk of breast cancer

edges.description: TP53 mutations are common in colorectal cancer progression

properties.evidence: TP53 mutations found in 50-70% of colorectal cancers

edges.description: Erlotinib inhibits EGFR tyrosine kinase activity

properties.mechanism: Competitive inhibition of ATP binding to EGFR kinase domain
Monoclonal antibody binds to extracellular domain of EGFR

edges.description: Erlotinib is approved for treatment of EGFR-mutant NSCLC

properties.indication: First-line treatment for EGFR mutation-positive NSCLC

edges.description: Cetuximab is used to treat KRAS wild-type metastatic colorectal cancer

properties.indication: Treatment of EGFR-expressing, KRAS wild-type mCRC

edges.description: Olaparib is particularly effective in BRCA1-mutated cancers

properties.mechanism: PARP inhibition is synthetic lethal with BRCA1 deficiency

edges.description: Olaparib is approved for BRCA-mutated breast cancer

properties.indication: Treatment of germline BRCA-mutated HER2-negative breast cancer
